reference: Volume Three, Issue Thirty-Three, File 4 of 13
title: FEDIX
authors: Written by the people at FEDIX
historical_context: FEDIX was an important resource in the early 1990s for connecting educational institutions with federal research opportunities, reflecting the growing intersection of technology and education.
target_audience: Researchers, educators, students, and anyone interested in federal education and research funding.
short_summary: FEDIX is an online information service that connects the higher education community with federal government resources, providing updates on research programs, scholarships, and grants without any registration fees.
summary: The article outlines the features of the FEDIX system, including its user-friendly menu structure, data capturing capabilities, and options for downloading information. Users can easily navigate through the system to find specific agency information, research program details, and educational resources. The article emphasizes the importance of this service in promoting research and education, particularly for minority assistance programs. By providing a centralized platform for accessing federal resources, FEDIX plays a crucial role in supporting educational institutions and researchers in their pursuit of funding and information.
